column1: Slings can be used for many different injuries.

Loosen the splint and bandage if: - The area becomes cool or turns pale or blue - Numbness or tingling develops in the injured body part Injuries to nerves or blood vessels often occur with an arm injury.
Splints reduce pain, and help prevent further damage to muscles, nerves, and blood vessels.
(If the sling is for a child, you can use a smaller size.)
- Adjust the sling so the arm rests comfortably, with the hand higher than the elbow.
Seek medical help if the person has a dislocation, broken bone, or severe bleeding.
Some diseases make bones break more easily, so use caution when helping a person with fragile bones.
